news_headline: Total cryptocurrency market value crosses $1 trillion for the 1st time
news_article: The total market value of cryptocurrencies passed $1 trillion for the first time on Thursday. The market value has climbed fivefold in the past year, as per CoinGecko data. Bitcoin, which rose 4% on Thursday to hit a record high of $37,000, represents around two-thirds of the cryptocurrency market value. Ether represents about 14% of the market value.

news_headline: Twitter locks Trump's account for 12 hrs, FB bans him from posting for 24 hrs
news_article: Twitter has locked US President Donald Trump's account for 12 hours for "repeated and severe violations" of its Civic Integrity Policy and asked him to delete three tweets that were posted on Wednesday. If he doesn't delete them, his account will remain suspended indefinitely, it said. Facebook has blocked Trump's page from posting for 24 hours due to policy violations.

news_headline: Musk only $3 bn away from becoming world's richest person: Bloomberg
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is just $3 billion away from becoming the world's richest person overtaking Jeff Bezos, according to Bloomberg. A 2.8% rally in Tesla's share price on Wednesday pushed Musk's net worth to $181.1 billion. Over the past year, his net worth soared by over $150 billion, led by a more than 700% rise in Tesla stock.

news_headline: US says India's digital tax discriminates against its companies
news_article: The US has said that digital services taxes adopted by India as well as Italy and Turkey discriminate against American companies and are inconsistent with international tax principles. However,  the US said it won't be taking specific actions for now. India last year imposed a 2% tax on transactions where companies take payment abroad for digital services provided in India.

news_headline: JPMorgan, PayPal, Reddit chiefs condemn US Capitol violence
news_article: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon, PayPal CEO Dan Schulman and Reddit Co-founder Alexis Ohanian took to social media to condemn the violence at the US Capitol in Washington that left four dead. Schulman called the violence "shocking and disturbing", while Ohanian described the rioters as "domestic terrorists". "We are better than this," JPMorgan's Dimon said.

news_headline: Unprecedented lawlessness: IBM CEO Arvind Krishna on US Capitol violence
news_article: IBM CEO Arvind Krishna condemned the violence that took over the US Capitol in Washington DC and left four dead. "IBM condemns today's unprecedented lawlessness and we call for it to end immediately. These actions have no place in our society, and they must stop so our system of democracy can work," Krishna tweeted.

news_headline: US planning to add Alibaba, Tencent to China investment blacklist: Report
news_article: The Donald Trump-led administration is considering adding Chinese tech giants Alibaba and Tencent to a blacklist of firms it alleges are owned or controlled by the Chinese military, Reuters reported. The list already includes China’s top chipmaker SMIC and oil giant CNOOC. Alibaba and Tencent are among Asia's most valuable companies, with a combined net worth of $1.3 trillion.

news_headline: Telegram's People Nearby can reveal users' exact location: Report
news_article: A cybersecurity blog Ahmed's Notes pointed out that Telegram’s People Nearby feature can be exploited to know the exact location of users. The feature lets users send messages to other Telegram users nearby. The blog revealed that one can spoof their location for three points and use them to draw three triangulation circles to know the exact location of users.

news_headline: RBI warns of fraud using mobile numbers similar to banks' toll free number
news_article: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has issued a notice cautioning against a new social engineering fraud that is underway, using mobile numbers similar to toll free numbers of banks. RBI added that fraudsters also register these similar mobile numbers in the name of banks and financial institutions on caller identification mobile apps such as Truecaller to fool customers.

news_headline: WikiLeaks Founder Julian Assange denied bail by UK court
news_article: WikiLeaks Founder Julian Assange has been denied bail by a UK court. The decision comes after the British court's ruling on Monday, which said that Assange could not be extradited to US as he was likely to commit suicide under harsh prison conditions. The 49-year-old Founder will continue to be held at London's maximum-security Belmarsh prison.

news_headline: US diplomats asked to stop social media posts after US Capitol violence: Report
news_article: US State Department has reportedly asked diplomats overseas to suspend all social media posts after President Donald Trump's supporters stormed the US Capitol on Wednesday. They've been asked to remove scheduled content for Facebook and Twitter, reported CNN. The State Department has only retweeted a thread by Secretary of State Michael Pompeo's account saying, the violence was unacceptable.

news_headline: Tesla CEO Elon Musk takes dig at Facebook, Trump after US Capitol violence
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted a meme taking a dig at Facebook and President Donald Trump hours after violence ensued at the US Capitol leaving four dead. The world's second-richest person wrote "This is called the domino effect", along with a photo that apparently suggests how social media and Facebook led to the violence that emerged from Trump's orders.

news_headline: Trump has removed tweets, access to be restored after 12-hr block: Twitter
news_article: US President Donald Trump has removed the tweets which led to the suspension of his Twitter account for 12 hours, a Twitter spokesperson said. He will regain access to his account and will be able to post again after the 12-hour suspension period. Twitter had earlier said that President Trump's account would remain locked if the tweets were not removed.

news_headline: Facebook, Instagram block all content posted to #StormTheCapitol
news_article: Facebook and Instagram have begun blocking content posted to the #StormTheCapitol hashtag after violence at the US Capitol in Washington DC. Facebook said it is in the process of removing any content praising the Trump supporters who infiltrated the US Capitol. The two also barred President Donald Trump from posting to his accounts for 24 hours.

news_headline: Facebook, YouTube remove video posted by Trump after US Capitol violence
news_article: Facebook and YouTube have removed a video posted by US President Donald Trump calling his supporters who stormed the US Capitol "special". "We believe [the video] contributes to rather than diminishes the risk of ongoing violence," Facebook VP of Integrity tweeted. Twitter also restricted users from retweeting, liking or replying to the video and later, removed it from the platform.

news_headline: Facebook ordered to pay $4.7 million for copying an app in Italy
news_article: An Italian court has ordered Facebook to pay $4.7 million in damages to a software company for copying an app. Facebook copied their 'Nearby' feature from Business Competence's 'Faround' app, which allows users to identify shops, clubs, restaurants in their area, the judges said. "We have received the court's decision and are examining it carefully," a Facebook spokesperson told Reuters.

news_headline: Apple to modify bonuses by up to 10% based on environmental values in '21
news_article: Apple will modify cash bonuses for executives in 2021 based on their performance against the company's social and environmental values. It could reduce or increase bonus payouts by up to 10%, Apple said. The company lists six core values that include environmental practices such as using recycled materials in products, diversity and inclusion in workforce and privacy of devices.

news_headline: NVIDIA's $40 billion acquisition of Arm to be probed by UK regulator
news_article: UK's Competition and Markets Authority on Wednesday said it will start an investigation into American graphics card maker NVIDIA's $40 billion deal to buy British chip designer Arm Holdings. The competition regulator will consider whether Arm has an incentive to withdraw, raise prices or reduce the quality of its IP licencing services to NVIDIA's rivals, following the takeover.

news_headline: Facebook Pages will no longer show number of 'likes'
news_article: Facebook on Wednesday announced that it'll be making some changes to Facebook Pages. The redesign will no longer feature the "like" button or display the total number of "likes" the Pages receive. Further, Pages will get their own News Feed, allowing them to participate in conversations as the public figure or the brand, follow trends and interact with their fans.

news_headline: 9K families in Maha slums get addresses based on latitudes, longitudes
news_article: At least 9,000 families living in slums in Maharashtra's Pune, Thane, Navi Mumbai and Kolhapur got independent digital addresses, based on their latitudes and longitudes, called 'Plus Codes'. "For basic facilities...navigable location address is a must in the digital era," a Pune-based NGO said. "Lack of granular data has...hampered governments from reaching out to vulnerable families," NGO added.

news_headline: Apple App Store users spent $540 mn on Jan 1, biggest single-day record
news_article: Apple on Wednesday said that App Store users spent over $540 million on New Year's Day, setting a new single-day spending record. Further, users spent $1.8 billion on digital goods and services during the last week of 2020, driven largely by games. Apple noted that Zoom, Disney+, Among Us and Roblox were among 2020's most downloaded apps.

news_headline: Snapchat locks Trump's account after violence at US Capitol
news_article: Snapchat has locked US President Donald Trump's account after his supporters stormed the US Capitol. Snap will monitor the situation closely before re-evaluating its decision, a company spokesperson told TechCrunch. Earlier in June, the company said that President Trump's content would no longer be promoted in its "Discover" tab and would be visible to people who specifically search for it.

news_headline: Saddened by this mob violence: Mark Zuckerberg on US Capitol violence
news_article: Condemning the violence that occurred at the US Capitol, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg said that it was "a dark moment" in US history. "I'm personally saddened by this mob violence - which is exactly what this is," Zuckerberg wrote in a memo to his staff. He further said that peaceful transition of power is critical to the functioning of democracy.

news_headline: Cueist Pankaj Advani marries celebrity makeup artist Saniya Shadadpuri, shares pics
news_article: Indian cueist Pankaj Advani tied the knot with celebrity makeup artist and hairstylist Saniya Shadadpuri in an intimate ceremony with family and close friends in Mumbai on Wednesday. He took to Instagram to share pictures from the ceremony and wrote, "January 6, 2021...The birthdate of our union...A celebration of a new journey we take together."

news_headline: Stop this right now: Anushka criticises publication for invading her, Virat's privacy
news_article: Actress Anushka Sharma took to her Instagram Stories to criticise a publication for invading her and her husband, India captain Virat Kohli's privacy. The publication had shared a picture of Virat and Anushka having breakfast in their balcony. "Despite requesting the said photographer and the publication, they still continue to invade our privacy. Guys! Stop this right now!" Anushka wrote.

news_headline: Bumrah imitates Smith after he shouts 'No run', video goes viral
news_article: A video of Team India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah imitating Australia batsman Steve Smith during the first day of the Sydney Test has gone viral on social media. Bumrah shook his body while imitating Smith, who had shouted 'No run'. The video shows Bumrah mimicking Smith while returning to his run-up. Mohammed Siraj was seen patting on Bumrah's back.

news_headline: Aus score 166/2 on rain-hit Day 1 of SCG Test, debutant Saini picks maiden wicket
news_article: Australia ended the first day of the third Test against India at Sydney Cricket Ground at 166/2 after rain delay led to only 55 overs being bowled. Playing his first-ever Test innings, Australia opener Will Pucovski scored 62 runs off 110 deliveries. India debutant Navdeep Saini dismissed Pucovski to take his first-ever wicket in Test cricket.

news_headline: Footballer's ₹3-crore Lamborghini damaged after accident in UK, pic surfaces
news_article: Sheffield United's French striker Lys Mousset's £300,000 (₹3-crore) orange Lamborghini was damaged after it collided into parked cars on Abbeydale Road South. A picture of the wrecked car emerged online, after which Sheffield United said that they are making internal inquiries. South Yorkshire Police have confirmed that two men in their 20s were arrested on suspicion of drunk driving.

news_headline: No one should complain about the 5-star prisons: Irfan Pathan on bio-bubble
news_article: Talking about bio-bubble norms, former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan said that sportspersons should not complain if sports are going around the world even with the five-star prisons. "It’s the way it is. You have got to make sure you enjoy every bit of it, even if you are in the bubble," he added.

news_headline: How has Rohit Sharma performed as opener in Test cricket?
news_article: India vice-captain Rohit Sharma will be opening for the first time overseas in Test cricket during the third Test against Australia, which starts in Sydney tomorrow. Rohit has opened in six Test innings, which all came in 2019. He has scored 556 runs at an average of 92.66 as an opener in Test cricket. His highest score is 212.

news_headline: He was called the 'Mumbai Bradman': Shastri unveils Gavaskar's portrait at SCG
news_article: India head coach Ravi Shastri unveiled a portrait of former India captain Sunil Gavaskar at the Sydney Cricket Ground (SCG). “In his prime, he was called the 'Mumbai Bradman' when he was getting all those hundreds. In that era, to reach 34 hundreds and 13 just against the mighty West Indies was fabulous," Shastri said.

news_headline: Claire Polosak becomes first-ever female match official in a men's Test match
news_article: Australia's 32-year-old umpire Claire Polosak has become the first-ever female match official in a men's Test match. Polosak is the fourth umpire in the third Test match between India and Australia which is taking place in Sydney. Polosak had become the first-ever woman to officiate in a men's ODI on April 27, 2019.

news_headline: Jaffer quotes Dhoni's comment after seeing Siraj cry during National Anthem
news_article: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to share a picture of pacer Mohammed Siraj breaking down in tears during National Anthem at Sydney Cricket Ground. "Even if there's little or no crowd to cheer you on...no better motivation than playing for India. As a legend [MS Dhoni] once said, 'You don't play for...crowd...you play for the country'," Jaffer wrote.

news_headline: Siraj breaks down during national anthem at SCG, Cricket Australia shares video
news_article: India pacer Mohammed Siraj got emotional and was seen wiping his tears while the national anthem was being played before the start of play on Day one of the third Test between India and Australia. The video was tweeted by Cricket Australia. Siraj lost his father at the start of the tour before making his debut in the second Test.

news_headline: Ganguly discharged from hospital after angioplasty, says 'I am absolutely fine'
news_article: BCCI President and former India captain Sourav Ganguly said he was "absolutely fine" after he was discharged from the hospital on Thursday. "I thank the Woodlands Hospital and all the doctors for the excellent care...Hope I would be ready to fly soon," he added while leaving the hospital. Ganguly underwent angioplasty after he suffered a heart attack on January 2.

news_headline: World's oldest living first-class cricketer Alan Burgess dies in his sleep aged 100
news_article: World's oldest living first-class cricketer, New Zealand's Alan Burgess, died in his sleep at the age of 100 years and 250 days, New Zealand Cricket announced. Burgess played a total of 14 first-class matches, in which he scored 466 runs and picked up 16 wickets. He had also turned out for New Zealand Services as a tank driver in WWII.

news_headline: I'll remember forever what you did for me in last 5 days: Ganguly on pic with friend
news_article: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly shared his first post after getting discharged from hospital, where he was admitted following a heart attack. Ganguly shared a picture with his friend Joydeep and wrote, "What you have done for me in the last 5 days is something I will remember for life...have known you for 40 years now...and it's gone beyond just family."

news_headline: India's 100-yr-old Chandorkar now oldest living 1st class cricketer as Burgess dies
news_article: Former wicketkeeper Raghunath Chandorkar, who turned 100 years old last November, has become the oldest living first-class cricketer. This comes after New Zealand's Alan Burgess, who held the title, passed away at the age of 100 years and 250 days on Wednesday. Chandorkar, who was born in Maharashtra's Karjat, played seven first-class matches and scored 155 runs.

news_headline: How has India's head-to-head record been against Australia in Tests at SCG?
news_article: India and Australia have played a total of 12 Test matches between them at Sydney Cricket Ground (SCG). Australia have beaten India five times in Tests at SCG, while six Australia-India Test matches have ended in a draw at the stadium. India's only Test victory against Australia at SCG had come in January 1978.

news_headline: Sexist clown: Serena Williams' husband after billionaire comments on her weight
news_article: American tennis player Serena Williams' husband Alexis Ohanian labelled Romanian billionaire Ion Tiriac a "sexist clown" after he commented on her weight. Tiriac stated Serena should retire, adding, "At this age and the weight she is now, she does not move as easily as she did 15 years ago." "No one gives a damn what Ion Țiriac thinks," Alexis tweeted.

news_headline: Want certain people to remember this pic: Kaif on Siraj crying during National Anthem
news_article: Former batsman Mohammad Kaif took to Twitter to share a picture of Team India fast bowler Mohammed Siraj crying during the National Anthem at Sydney Cricket Ground ahead of the third Test against Australia. "I just want certain people to remember this picture. He is Mohammed Siraj and this is what the National Anthem means to him," Kaif wrote.

news_headline: 'My hair has turned grey waiting for it': Sachin told Raina on reaching 100th hundred
news_article: Former India batsman Suresh Raina, who was at the non-striker's end when Sachin Tendulkar scored his 100th international hundred, has revealed what the latter told him on reaching the milestone. Raina said, "I congratulated him saying, 'Well done, paaji, it was due for so many months.' Sachin said, 'My hair has turned grey waiting for this moment'."

news_headline: Smith's wife shares video of him shadow batting in kit in hotel room, calls him a kid
news_article: Australia batsman Steve Smith's wife Dani Willis took to Instagram Stories to share a video of her husband batting in full kit in their hotel room. "Like a kid on Christmas Eve," she wrote. Smith shared Dani's post and wrote, "Sometimes you've just got to shadow bat in full kit to get the feel."

news_headline: NBA teams react to pro-Trump mob storming the US Capitol
news_article: NBA teams Miami Heat and Boston Celtics on Wednesday knelt for the national anthem in protest after a mob of Donald Trump supporters stormed the US Capitol. In a joint statement both teams said they were playing "with a heavy heart". Meanwhile, Toronto Raptors and Phoenix Suns decided to join arms in circle for the American and Canadian anthems.

news_headline: Fit Shami, Ishant and Umesh would ensure no Australian reply: Gambhir
news_article: Ex-India cricketer Gautam Gambhir feels that the Australian batting line-up would have difficulties facing "India's main attack" of Shami, Ishant and Umesh if the trio wasn't injured. "I haven't seen this kind of Australian batting line-up in my life...Vulnerability is there," Gambhir said. While Shami got injured in the first Test, Umesh picked an injury in the second one.

news_headline: Wanted to put Ashwin under a bit of pressure: Steve Smith
news_article: Australia batsman Steve Smith said he intended to put Ravichandran Ashwin under pressure on Day 1 of the SCG Test on Thursday, something he "hasn't done in this series" till now. Ashwin has dismissed Smith twice in the first two Tests of series. At stumps on Day 1, Smith is batting on 31 along with Marnus Labuschagne (67*).

news_headline: Will be interesting to see how Siraj, Saini handle pressure against Aus: McGrath
news_article: Ex-Australia pacer Glenn McGrath said it will be interesting to watch how young Indian pacers Mohammed Siraj and Navdeep Saini "stand up if Australian batsmen can apply pressure". "When things are going well, everything is fine. It's when the pressure comes that you miss that experience," said McGrath. Saini made his debut in the third Test at the SCG.

news_headline: People confuse 'Via Getty' picture credit with US protester's name
news_article: Some people believed that a man who joined the protests at the US Capitol was named 'Via Getty' after his picture was posted on Twitter and 'via Getty' was written in the caption as picture's credit. The confusion began with the placement of the comma in the caption. A user wrote, "Via Getty, that's his name, let's get this guy."

news_headline: US friends buying groceries offered COVID-19 vaccines as they were set to expire
news_article: Two friends in the US who were buying groceries at a supermarket received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine. A pharmacist approached them to ask if they were interested in getting the vaccine and told them that many first responders missed their vaccine appointments. As the vaccines couldn't be kept at room temperature beyond a few hours, they would have to be discarded.

news_headline: Tim Cook, Sundar Pichai condemn violence at US Capitol
news_article: Apple CEO Tim Cook, condemning the violence at the US Capitol on Wednesday, said, "Today marks a sad and shameful chapter in our nation's history." "Those responsible for this insurrection should be held to account," Cook added. Google and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai also condemned the "lawlessness and violence" and said that it is the "antithesis of democracy".

news_headline: Not a cricket match: Vir Das after Indian Flag spotted at US Capitol protests
news_article: After Indian Flag was spotted at US Capitol protests, comedian Vir Das tweeted, "Dear random Indian dude waving Indian Flag...Every large crowd is not a cricket match!" Meanwhile, a Twitter user wrote, "Not the place where we'd like to see our Indian Flag." BJP MP Varun Gandhi tweeted, "This is one fight we definitely don’t need to participate in."

news_headline: Twitter users share pics from Simpsons episode 'predicting' US Capitol violence
news_article:
As photos and videos of the US Capitol violence trended on social media, several Twitter users joked that such a situation may have already been predicted by The Simpsons.
Users shared screengrabs from an old episode that showed the storming of the US Capitol building. Trump supporters had stormed the Capitol building and clashed with the police on Wednesday.

news_headline: How did world leaders react to Trump supporters storming US Capitol?
news_article: After supporters of President Donald Trump stormed the US Capitol building, French President Emmanuel Macron said, "What happened today in Washington, DC is not American." "Disgraceful scenes...it's...vital that there should be a peaceful...transfer of power," UK PM Boris Johnson tweeted. "We hope to see democracy in the US overcome this difficult situation," Japan's Chief Cabinet Secretary said.

news_headline: What led to the storming of the US Capitol by Donald Trump supporters?
news_article: Hours before the storming of the US Capitol, Donald Trump addressed his supporters at a rally, protesting against the certification of Joe Biden's victory in US Presidential elections. "After this, we're going to walk down there...we're going to walk down…to the Capitol," Trump said. Three of Trump's tweets were also removed by Twitter for 'severe violations of Civic Integrity policy'.

news_headline: Nothing will stop us: Woman tweeted hours before being killed at US Capitol
news_article: A woman who was shot at the US Capitol when Trump's backers stormed the US Capitol was Ashli Babbitt, a US Air Force veteran. Hours before her death, she had tweeted, "Nothing will stop us...they can try and try and try but the storm is here." Her mother-in-law said, "I really don't know why she decided to do this."

news_headline: Mexico offers to provide COVID-19 vaccines to undocumented migrants in US
news_article: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said that Mexico is ready to provide coronavirus vaccines to undocumented migrants in the US, after Nebraska Governor said they would likely not get vaccinated due to their immigration status. "It is a universal right," Obrador added. Many of the undocumented migrants in the US are Mexican nationals, Reuters reported.

news_headline: There will be an orderly transition to Biden presidency: Trump
news_article: After US Congress certified President-elect Joe Biden's victory in the presidential election, President Donald Trump said, "Even though I totally disagree with the outcome of the election...there'll be an orderly transition on January 20th." "I've always said we would continue our fight to ensure that only legal votes were counted," he added. Biden beat Trump 306-232 in the Electoral College.

news_headline: South Africa to buy 15 lakh vaccines from Serum Institute of India
news_article: South Africa’s health ministry on Thursday said that the country would get 15 lakh COVID-19 vaccines from the Serum Institute of India (SII). The first batch of 10 lakh would be sent in January and the remainder the following month. This comes after the Indian government clarified that the export of COVID-19 vaccines has not been banned.

news_headline: Tesla CEO Elon Musk takes dig at Facebook, Trump after US Capitol violence
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted a meme taking a dig at Facebook and President Donald Trump hours after violence ensued at the US Capitol leaving four dead. The world's second-richest person wrote "This is called the domino effect", along with a photo that apparently suggests how social media and Facebook led to the violence that emerged from Trump's orders.

news_headline: Facebook, YouTube remove video posted by Trump after US Capitol violence
news_article: Facebook and YouTube have removed a video posted by US President Donald Trump calling his supporters who stormed the US Capitol "special". "We believe [the video] contributes to rather than diminishes the risk of ongoing violence," Facebook VP of Integrity tweeted. Twitter also restricted users from retweeting, liking or replying to the video and later, removed it from the platform.

news_headline: Trump has removed tweets, access to be restored after 12-hr block: Twitter
news_article: US President Donald Trump has removed the tweets which led to the suspension of his Twitter account for 12 hours, a Twitter spokesperson said. He will regain access to his account and will be able to post again after the 12-hour suspension period. Twitter had earlier said that President Trump's account would remain locked if the tweets were not removed.

news_headline: Saddened by this mob violence: Mark Zuckerberg on US Capitol violence
news_article: Condemning the violence that occurred at the US Capitol, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg said that it was "a dark moment" in US history. "I'm personally saddened by this mob violence - which is exactly what this is," Zuckerberg wrote in a memo to his staff. He further said that peaceful transition of power is critical to the functioning of democracy.

news_headline: US diplomats asked to stop social media posts after US Capitol violence: Report
news_article: US State Department has reportedly asked diplomats overseas to suspend all social media posts after President Donald Trump's supporters stormed the US Capitol on Wednesday. They've been asked to remove scheduled content for Facebook and Twitter, reported CNN. The State Department has only retweeted a thread by Secretary of State Michael Pompeo's account saying, the violence was unacceptable.

news_headline: Snapchat locks Trump's account after violence at US Capitol
news_article: Snapchat has locked US President Donald Trump's account after his supporters stormed the US Capitol. Snap will monitor the situation closely before re-evaluating its decision, a company spokesperson told TechCrunch. Earlier in June, the company said that President Trump's content would no longer be promoted in its "Discover" tab and would be visible to people who specifically search for it.

news_headline: Facebook, Instagram block all content posted to #StormTheCapitol
news_article: Facebook and Instagram have begun blocking content posted to the #StormTheCapitol hashtag after violence at the US Capitol in Washington DC. Facebook said it is in the process of removing any content praising the Trump supporters who infiltrated the US Capitol. The two also barred President Donald Trump from posting to his accounts for 24 hours.

news_headline: Sudan signs deal with US to normalise relations with Israel
news_article: Sudan on Wednesday signed the "Abraham Accords" with the United States to normalise relations with Israel. This comes less than a month after US President Donald Trump removed Sudan from its blacklist of state sponsors of terrorism. The US embassy in Khartoum said the agreement will "help further Sudan on its transformative path to stability, security, and economic opportunity".

news_headline: Democrats gain control of US Senate after winning both seats in Georgia
news_article: The Democratic Party has gained control of the US Senate after it won both seats in runoff elections in Georgia. With this victory, both Democrats and Republicans have 50 members each in the 100-seat Senate. However, VP-elect Kamala Harris, who would be sworn in on January 20, would cast any tie-breaking votes in the Senate, thus giving Democrats a majority.

news_headline: Pompeo threatens US sanctions over Hong Kong mass arrests
news_article: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Thursday threatened sanctions against individuals and organisations involved in the arrest of over 50 Hong Kong pro-democracy activists. "The US will not stand idly by while the people of Hong Kong suffer under Communist oppression," he said. Pompeo added he was "appalled" by the arrest of an American as part of the crackdown.

news_headline: Western democracy is fragile: Iran Prez after US Capitol siege
news_article: Calling Western democracy "fragile" and "vulnerable", Iran's President Hassan Rouhani said, "What happened in America showed what a failure Western democracy is". "A populist man (Trump) damaged the reputation of his country," he added. Rouhani's comments came after US President Donald Trump's supporters stormed the US Capitol building on Wednesday in an attempt to overturn the election results.

news_headline: Beijing records coldest morning in over 5 decades at -19.6°C
news_article: Beijing recorded a minimum temperature of -19.6°C on Thursday, the coldest morning in the Chinese capital since 1966, state-run media reported. Ten out of Beijing's 20 national-level meteorological stations registered the lowest recorded early January temperatures on Thursday morning, reports stated. The authorities have urged the public to take precautions against the weather.

news_headline: FBI seeks info to identify instigators of violence at US Capitol
news_article: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) on Wednesday said that it is "seeking information that will assist in identifying individuals" who instigated the violence at the US Capitol in Washington, DC. "Our goal is to preserve the public's constitutional right to protest by protecting everyone from violence and other criminal activity," it added. Four people have died in the violence.

news_headline: Protests over killing of 11 miners spreads to other cities in Pak
news_article: Protests over the killing of 11 coal miners belonging to the minority Hazara community by Islamic State (ISIS) have spread to other cities in Pakistan, including Karachi. A protest by Hazara in Quetta along with coffins carrying the victims' bodies has entered the fifth day. PM Imran Khan is expected to visit the protesters in Quetta soon, local media reported.

news_headline: Won't get COVID-19 vaccine now, priority groups must be vaccinated first: MP CM
news_article: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Monday said that he has decided not to get vaccinated against COVID-19 for now, as the first shots should be administered to the priority groups. He said, "My turn should come afterwards, we have to work to ensure that priority groups are administered with the vaccine."

news_headline: PM Modi inaugurates 450-km Kochi-Mangaluru natural gas pipeline
news_article: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday inaugurated a natural gas pipeline from Kerala's Kochi to Mangaluru in Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada district via video conference. PM Modi said, "It is an honour to dedicate the 450-km pipeline to the nation. This is an important day for India, especially for people of Karnataka and Kerala."

news_headline: TMC MLA Laxmi Ratan Shukla resigns as West Bengal Minister
news_article: TMC MLA and former cricketer Laxmi Ratan Shukla has resigned as the Minister of State for Sports and Youth Services in West Bengal. He has also resigned as the Howrah district president of the party. "He wrote in his resignation letter that he wants to give more time to sports and will continue as an MLA," CM Mamata Banerjee said.

news_headline: Reminded of Jallianwala tragedy: Chadha as farmers tear-gassed in Rewari
news_article: AAP MLA and national spokesperson Raghav Chadha on Monday compared Haryana CM ML Khattar to British General Reginald Dyer. This came after Haryana Police fired tear gas canisters on a group of marching protesters in Rewari on Sunday. "I was reminded of April 1919, when General Dyer ordered opening fire on innocent people who congregated at Jallianwala Bagh," said Chadha.

news_headline: Distressed to see news about rioting and violence in Washington DC: PM Modi
news_article: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday tweeted, "Distressed to see news about rioting and violence in Washington DC. Orderly and peaceful transfer of power must continue." He added, "The democratic process cannot be allowed to be subverted through unlawful protests." This comes after US President Donald Trump's supporters stormed the US Capitol and disrupted electoral count.

news_headline: PM inaugurates 306-km Rewari-Madar section of Western Dedicated Freight Corridor
news_article: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday inaugurated the 306-km long New Rewari-New Madar section of the Western Dedicated Freight Corridor. This section of the freight corridor is situated in Haryana and Rajasthan. PM Modi also flagged off the world's first Double Stack Long Haul 1.5-km long container train hauled by electric traction from Haryana's Ateli to Rajasthan's Kishangarh through video conference.

news_headline: Stand-up comedian Munawar Faruqui's arrest shames us all: Tharoor
news_article: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has said the arrest of stand-up comedian Munawar Faruqui "shames us all". Tharoor tweeted, "As a democracy; as a country mature enough to enjoy a laugh; as a society that does not discriminate...In none of these categories can we hold our head high." Faruqui and four others were arrested for allegedly insulting Hindu deities in Indore.

news_headline: U'khand CM apologises to Cong leader after state BJP chief calls her 'budhiya'
news_article: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Trivendra Singh Rawat has apologised to the Leader of Opposition in state Assembly after state BJP chief Bansidhar Bhagat called her "budhiya". A delegation of Congress leaders led by state party chief Pritam Singh met DGP Ashok Kumar and gave a letter demanding an FIR against Bhagat under appropriate sections for his remaks.

news_headline: WB CM Mamata stands in line to collect health scheme card, pics surface
news_article: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday stood in a queue along with other locals to collect her ‘Swasthya Sathi’ smart card from a distribution centre in Kolkata. Banerjee had earlier urged ministers of her government to collect the card. The scheme provides health cover of up to ₹5 lakh per annum to a family for secondary and tertiary care.

news_headline: Odisha Minister Pratap Jena among 13 booked for murder of BJP leader, aide
news_article: The Odisha police has registered a case against 13 people, including state Law Minister Pratap Jena, after 75-year-old BJP leader Kulamani Baral and his associate were hacked to death in Cuttack district. The case was registered on the basis of a complaint by Baral's son, who alleged that his father was killed at the behest of Jena.

news_headline: I'm sure farm unions will think about farmers' welfare, reach a solution: Tomar
news_article: Union Agriculture Minister Narendra Singh Tomar on Wednesday said he is sure the farmer unions that are protesting against the farm laws will think about the welfare of farmers and arrive at a solution through a discussion. He said, "The government of India is committed to the welfare of farmers." Farmers will hold a tractor march around Delhi on Thursday.

news_headline: Who will get vaccine with question marks on reliability: Manish Tewari
news_article: Congress leader Manish Tewari on Tuesday said the Centre has "politically misused" the COVID-19 pandemic. Without naming the vaccine, Tewari said, "In their quest to prove their 'Atmanirbhar Bharat' they have licensed a vaccine whose phase 3 trials are not complete." He added, "Who is going to get himself vaccinated with a vaccine that has question marks on its reliability?"

news_headline: Shoes hurled at Vijayvargiya, Mukul Roy's vehicles during BJP roadshow
news_article: Shoes were hurled at the vehicles of BJP leaders Kailash Vijayvargiya and Mukul Roy on Monday when they had gone for a roadshow in Kolkata's Watganj area. The roadshow had to be shortened after police denied permission for it. "Some TMC workers hurled shoes and stones at us. Our workers showed restraint," Vijayvargiya claimed.

news_headline: PM Modi should take first shot of COVID-19 vaccine: Bihar Cong leader
news_article: Bihar's Congress leader Ajeet Sharma has said PM Narendra Modi should take the first shot of COVID-19 vaccine. Sharma said heads of state in Russia and America took the first shots of the vaccine to remove people's doubts. He added PM Modi and the senior-most BJP leader should "win the trust of the people" by taking the first vaccine shots.

news_headline: BJP MP Pragya Thakur appears in court in Malegaon blast case
news_article: BJP MP Pragya Thakur, one of the seven accused in the 2008 Malegaon blast case, on Monday appeared before the special court of the National Investigation Agency (NIA) in Mumbai. The court, however, adjourned the hearing for Tuesday and asked her to be present in court whenever required after she sought exemption from daily appearance on health and security grounds.

news_headline: Shiv Sena leader survives after being shot at in Mumbai
news_article: Shiv Sena's shakha pramukh from Mumbai's Bhiwandi, Deepak Mhatre, was shot at by bike-borne assailants on Saturday night. Mhatre, shot outside his residence, has survived the attack. The police said, "There is suspicion that the attack may be linked to the upcoming gram panchayat elections in the area as Mhatre is one of the hopeful aspirants in the race."

news_headline: Farmers' protest fight between langar & lathi: Congress' Shergill
news_article: Describing the BJP as "an agent of the East India Company," Congress leader Jaiveer Shergill on Monday said the ongoing farmers' agitation is a "fight between the langar and the lathi." Shergill urged the Centre to repeal the three "black" farm laws, and added, "The BJP is anti-farmer, tyrannical, dictatorial and its brutal face has been exposed."

news_headline: I appeal to Centre to accept all demands of farmers: Delhi CM
news_article: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said, "I appeal to the Centre to accept all...demands of the farmers and repeal the three black farm laws." "Salute to the resolve of the farmers staying firm on the roads despite rains and cold," he added. The seventh round of talks between the Centre and farmers' representatives took place on Monday.

news_headline: Former Maharashtra minister Vilas Patil Undalkar dies at 82
news_article: Maharashtra's former minister Vilas Patil Undalkar passed away aged 82 in Satara on Monday. He reportedly died after following a brief illness. Popularly known as kaka, Undalkar won from Karad South Assembly seat seven times till 2014. Ajit Pawar said that Undalkar will be remembered for his "vital contribution to the development of rural Maharashtra".

news_headline: Man threatens to kill Mumbai mayor Pednekar, detained in Gujarat
news_article: The police on Wednesday detained a man from Gujarat for allegedly giving death threats to Mumbai mayor and Shiv Sena leader Kishori Pednekar. A Mumbai Police team was sent to Gujarat's Jamnagar after the police traced a threatening phone call made to Pednekar's phone on December 21. The team is bringing the accused to Mumbai.

news_headline: No attempt to murder by protesters who dumped cow dung: Punjab CM
news_article: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh has ordered the withdrawal of an attempt to murder case against protesters who dumped cow dung outside a BJP leader's house. He also ordered the transfer of the SHO who registered the case, saying he had gone overboard. Protesters had unloaded a trolley carrying cow dung in front of former Punjab Minister Tikshan Sud's house.

news_headline: Absolutely no improvement in the situation: CJI on farmers' protest
news_article: A three-judge bench of the Supreme Court led by CJI SA Bobde set January 11 to hear a batch of pleas challenging the new farm laws and the issues related to the ongoing farmers’ protest. "There is absolutely no improvement in the situation," CJI said. However, Centre conveyed to SC that negotiations are underway between the farmers and government.

news_headline: Uttarakhand BJP chief calls 79-yr-old Cong leader 'budhiya', criticised
news_article: Uttarakhand BJP chief Bansidhar Bhagat has received criticism from several Congress members after he called 79-year-old Congress leader Indira Hridayesh a "budhiya" (old woman). Bhagat, who was responding to Hridayesh's claims that several BJP workers were in touch with the Congress, had said, "Why would they contact you, old woman? What would one want to do with a sinking ship?"

news_headline: Modi govt's apathy, arrogance has claimed lives of 60 farmers: Rahul
news_article: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said that Modi government's apathy and arrogance have claimed lives of over 60 farmers. "Instead of wiping their tears, GOI is busy attacking them with tear gas," Rahul said. He added, "Such brutality, just to promote crony capitalists' business interests. Repeal the anti-farm laws."

news_headline: TDP leader murdered in Andhra Pradesh, 2nd such killing in a week
news_article: Telugu Desam Party (TDP) leader Puramsetti Ankulu was allegedly murdered in Andhra Pradesh's Guntur district on Sunday night. His body was found at an under-construction apartment complex. A TDP leader alleged that it was a "cold-blooded murder" by Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress (YSRC) party. Another TDP leader Nandam Subbaiah was killed in Proddatur last week.

news_headline: Maharashtra waives entertainment duty of ₹3.4cr for 1996 Michael Jackson concert
news_article: Maharashtra cabinet on Wednesday waived off entertainment duty worth ₹3.4 crore and release it to event managers Wizcraft Entertainment, against Michael Jackson's 1996 Mumbai concert. It's the second time the government is making the decision, as its previous move was struck down by Bombay High Court in 2011. The waiver amount had to be deposited in the court's treasury.

news_headline: OnePlus launches gamified engagement of Netflix film, ‘AK vs AK’
news_article: OnePlus has partnered with Netflix to launch an online game, ‘AK vs AK: Stops at Nothing’ that captures fictionalised rivalry between Anil Kapoor & Anurag Kashyap as depicted in the Netflix film. "Through this partnership, we hoped to provide immersive experience...while creating synergy between OnePlus 8T 5G’s key features & Netflix’s AK vs AK", Siddhant Narayan, HOM, OnePlus India said.

news_headline: Sonu Sood 'converts' residential building into hotel without permission, complaint filed
news_article: BMC has filed a complaint against Sonu Sood for allegedly converting a six-storey residential building into a hotel without permission. It asked police to take cognisance of the offence, citing unauthorised additions, alterations and change of use. Sonu maintained he had BMC permissions for change of use and was only waiting for clearance from Maharashtra Coastal Zone Management Authority.

news_headline: Dilip Chhabria, arrested for ₹40-cr scam, accused of cheating by Kapil Sharma
news_article: Kapil Sharma has been summoned by Mumbai Police for his statement in connection with car designer Dilip Chhabria's alleged cheating and forgery case. He had filed a complaint against Chhabria for allegedly cheating him and has been called to record his statement as witness. Chhabria was arrested in DC Avanti car financing and forgery scam of at least ₹40 crore.

news_headline: US-based Pak woman claims Cezanne Khan married her for Green Card, shares 'proof'
news_article: A US-based woman of Pakistani descent, Aisha Pirani, has alleged 'Kasautii Zindagii Kay' fame actor Cezanne Khan was married to her from 2015-2017. "He cheated on me, used me...lived off my money. The moment he got Green Card, he filed for divorce," she told Times of India. "It's a case of an obsessive fan," Cezanne stated while refuting her claim.

news_headline: Cueist Pankaj Advani marries celebrity makeup artist Saniya Shadadpuri, shares pics
news_article: Indian cueist Pankaj Advani tied the knot with celebrity makeup artist and hairstylist Saniya Shadadpuri in an intimate ceremony with family and close friends in Mumbai on Wednesday. He took to Instagram to share pictures from the ceremony and wrote, "January 6, 2021...The birthdate of our union...A celebration of a new journey we take together."

news_headline: A casting director once called me at her home & screamed 'You're talentless': Nora
news_article: Actress Nora Fatehi revealed on Kareena Kapoor's show 'What Women Want' that a casting director called her home during her first few months in India and said she's "talentless". "She said, 'Our industry is...tired of people like you. We don't want you.' She was screaming at me," Nora added. "I just left and I cried so much," she said.

news_headline: Kim, Kanye fighting to keep $60mn mansion as she prepares for divorce: Reports
news_article: Kim Kardashian and Kanye West are both fighting to keep their $60 million mansion amid reports of Kim preparing to file for divorce, it has been reported. The property, which is home to their four children, reportedly has eight bedrooms, ten bathrooms, a theatre, basketball court and swimming pool. Kim and Kanye share a combined $2.2 billion fortune, reports added.

news_headline: Fashion designer Satya Paul passes away aged 78
news_article: Fashion designer Satya Paul passed away aged 78 on Wednesday at the Isha Yoga Center in Coimbatore. "Satya Paul, a shining example of what it means to live with immeasurable passion and unrelenting involvement," Founder of the Isha Foundation Sadhguru tweeted. "Satya Paul had suffered a stroke on December 2," his son Puneet Nanda wrote on Facebook.

news_headline: Babil shares dad Irrfan's video message for him, pays tribute on birth anniversary
news_article: Babil Khan has shared an old video on his father Irrfan Khan's 54th birth anniversary. The video shows Babil's mother, younger brother and Irrfan recording a message telling Babil that they miss him. "[I] don't remember anyone's birthdays because you never remembered mine and never encouraged me to remember yours...This time I couldn't forget yours if I tried," wrote Babil.

news_headline: Ajay, Sidharth Malhotra & Rakul to star in comedy film 'Thank God'
news_article: Ajay Devgn, Sidharth Malhotra and Rakul Preet Singh will star in a film titled 'Thank God'. It will be directed by Indra Kumar, who has previously helmed films like 'Dhamaal', 'Dil' and 'Great Grand Masti', among others. "It's an entertaining slice of life comedy with...message and I'm quite excited to be working again with Ajay...along with...Sidharth and Rakul," Indra said.

news_headline: Your legacy will live on forever: Anushka on Irrfan's birth anniversary
news_article: Several celebrities, including Anushka Sharma, Ayushmann Khurrana and Vicky Kaushal, took to social media to share a post on the 54th birth anniversary of Irrfan Khan. "A legendary figure of the industry! You'll always be missed and your legacy will live on forever," Anushka wrote while sharing a picture of the late actor. Meanwhile, Ayushmann wrote, "You'll always be remembered."

news_headline: OTT is the best thing that has happened for young talented people: Bobby
news_article: Talking about OTT platforms, Bobby Deol said that it is the best thing that has happened for young talented people. He added that they have got an opportunity to work not just as actors, but also as technicians and daily wage earners. Talking about the year 2020, Bobby said, "[It] taught us that the smallest things have the greatest value."

news_headline: I'd like all women to be as empowered as you: Tharoor to Kangana
news_article: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor responded to Kangana Ranaut's tweet wherein she opposed the idea of recognising household work done by homemakers as a salaried profession. Kangana wrote, "We don't need salary for being the Queens of our own little kingdom." Shashi wrote, "It's about...ensuring basic income to every woman. I'd like all Indian women to be as empowered as you!"

news_headline: I had to work harder: Pankaj on playing protagonist in 'Kaagaz'
news_article: Talking about playing the lead role in 'Kaagaz', actor Pankaj Tripathi said, "The responsibility didn't increase as such, but I did know that all eyes will be on my performance. So I had to work harder." He added, "An artiste does become more aware in such a scenario." Pankaj plays a character named Lal Bihari Mritak in the film.

news_headline: Sickening to say the least: Pooja Bhatt on Budaun gangrape
news_article: Commenting on Uttar Pradesh's Budaun gangrape case in which a 50-year-old woman was allegedly gangraped and killed at a place of worship, director and actress Pooja Bhatt tweeted, "When will this violence against women end?" She added, "This is sickening, to say the least. Is there no place in our country, especially in UP, where a woman is safe?"

news_headline: I've said no to a lot of money and directors, was not easy: Divyenndu
news_article: Actor Divyenndu, known for playing Munna Bhaiya in 'Mirzapur', revealed in an interview that he has said no to a lot of money and directors and added that it wasn't easy for him. "I need to have something different where I can show...complete side of me as an artiste," he added. Divyenndu will next be seen in 'The Last Rave'.

news_headline: Rhea will bounce back: Rumi Jaffery on film 'Chehre' with Big B, Emraan
news_article: Filmmaker Rumi Jaffery said that Rhea Chakraborty will "bounce back" with 'Chehre' starring Amitabh Bachchan and Emraan Hashmi. Commenting on Rhea's arrest in a drug case following Sushant Singh Rajput's death, Jaffery said, "I'm confident she will get through this phase. Everybody around will advise you to be brave, but only the one going through knows how difficult it is."

news_headline: Rahul Roy should be fine in 6-7 months: Relative after actor gets discharged
news_article: Actor Rahul Roy, who suffered a brain stroke in November while shooting for a film, has been discharged from Mumbai's Wockhardt Hospital. "It will take some time but he should be fine in 6-7 months," his brother-in-law Romeer Sen said. The 'Aashiqui' actor took to Instagram on Thursday and wrote, "I'm recovering...it's still a long journey for a full recovery."

news_headline: Super excited to reunite with Mohit sir for 'Ek Villain 2': Disha
news_article: Actress Disha Patani, who has worked with director Mohit Suri in 'Malang', has said that she is "super excited" to reunite with the 39-year-old filmmaker for 'Ek Villain 2'. She added, "After 'Malang', I am looking forward to working with him again and start a new journey."  'Ek Villain 2' also stars John Abraham, Arjun Kapoor and Tara Sutaria.

news_headline: Actor Varun Tej Konidela tests negative for coronavirus
news_article: Telugu actor Varun Tej Konidela, who contracted coronavirus last week, has now tested negative for the virus. The actor took to social media on Thursday to share the news and wrote, "Never thought a report saying 'Negative' would bring in so much joy to me. Yes, I tested COVID Negative. Thank you very much for all the love and prayers."

news_headline: Motherhood won't change my work choices: 'Ludo' actress Pearle
news_article: Actress Pearle Maaney, who is expecting her first child with actor Srinish Aravind, said that motherhood won't change her work choices. The 'Ludo' actress added, "I hope directors would consider me an actor and not a married woman or a mother, and work with me for my talent." She also called motherhood the "best feeling and education in the world".

news_headline: Now I've to become friends with everyone: Sajid on working after Wajid's death
news_article: Late music composer Wajid Khan's brother Sajid Khan, in an interview, spoke about working without his brother. "Before Wajid used to meet...and I always used to be inside. And now, I've to meet all...artists," he said. "All singers and artists, Wajid used to be friends with them. Now I've to become friends with everyone and work with them," Sajid added.

news_headline: We're looking to bring 1 of them during Holi: Makers on Sooryavanshi, 83
news_article: Talking about the release of 'Sooryavanshi' and '83', Reliance Entertainment Group CEO Shibasish Sarkar said, "We're looking at bringing one of the films in the third week of March, during Holi." He added, "The situation in the country is improving. A section of people headed to theatres to watch 'Tenet' and 'Wonder Woman 1984'. That was an encouraging sign."

news_headline: Own a car without buying it : Revv Subscriptions
news_article: You can now drive a new car every month as Revv provides the option to subscribe to your favourite car for 1-36 months with ₹0 down payment, ₹0 road tax and without the hassle of maintenance and service. The car will be sanitized and delivered to your doorstep ensuring complete safety for you and your loved ones.

news_headline: TATA Motors introduces all-new 'Safari' built on OMEGARC platform
news_article: TATA Motors has introduced the all-new 'Safari' built on OMEGARC, which is based on Land Rover D8 platform. The SUV draws a strong inspiration from the Safari lineage and enhances its pedigree of impeccable SUV stance, comfort, performance and robust build, TATA said. Safari is a true personification of luxury and power, it added.

news_headline: Dilip Chhabria, arrested for ₹40-cr scam, accused of cheating by Kapil Sharma
news_article: Kapil Sharma has been summoned by Mumbai Police for his statement in connection with car designer Dilip Chhabria's alleged cheating and forgery case. He had filed a complaint against Chhabria for allegedly cheating him and has been called to record his statement as witness. Chhabria was arrested in DC Avanti car financing and forgery scam of at least ₹40 crore.

news_headline: Tesla to start operations in India in early 2021, confirms Nitin Gadkari
news_article: Union Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday told The Indian Express that Elon Musk-led electric vehicle company Tesla will start operations in India in early 2021. He said Tesla will start operations first with sales and then maybe look at assembly and manufacturing. Some recent reports claimed that Tesla will launch Model 3 in India in June 2021.

news_headline: Honda Motorcycle offers voluntary retirement amid demand slowdown
news_article: Honda Motorcycle and Scooter India is offering voluntary retirement to employees amid slowing demand due to COVID-19, according to a letter. Employees who are above 40 years or have completed 10 years of service, as of January 31, 2021, are eligible for the scheme. The first 400 employees who opt for retirement would get an additional ₹5,00,000, the company said.

news_headline: Car designer Dilip Chhabria of DC Design arrested in case of alleged cheating
news_article: Renowned car designer Dilip Chhabria has been arrested in connection with an alleged cheating and forgery case, Mumbai Police said on Monday. Chhabria is the Founder of Indian design firm DC Design that makes concept cars and custom special order vehicles. One of his cars was also seized and Crime Branch said that there were more accused in the case.

news_headline: Why has Mumbai Police arrested car designer Dilip Chhabria of DC Design?
news_article: Mumbai Police revealed that car designer Dilip Chhabria, Founder of DC Design, has been arrested in DC Avanti car financing and forgery scam of at least ₹40 crore. Police said Chhabria was selling multiple cars with the same engine and chassis numbers. He's also accused of taking multiple loans on one car and then selling car to a third party.

news_headline: Ford cancels plan to give control of India business to Mahindra & Mahindra
news_article: US carmaker Ford on Thursday said it is calling off its automotive joint venture with Mahindra and Mahindra due to the challenges caused by the pandemic. Under the deal, Ford was expected to transfer its local operations, including two factories, into a joint venture that would be majority-controlled by Mahindra. Ford said its independent operations in India will continue.

news_headline: Bajaj Auto becomes world's most valuable two-wheeler company
news_article: Pune-based Bajaj Auto has said that it has become the world's most valuable two-wheeler company as its market capitalisation crossed ₹1 lakh crore. Bajaj Auto achieved this milestone as it celebrates the 75th year of its operations. Bajaj Auto on Monday reported an 11% increase in total sales at 3,72,532 units in December 2020.

news_headline: COVID-19 was black swan event for CV segment: Tata Motors
news_article: COVID-19 was a "black swan event" for commercial vehicle (CV) segment as it followed axle load norms, low freight demand and BS-VI impact, Girish Wagh, President, Tata Motors CV Business Unit, said. "It aggravated the slowdown the segment was already going through," he added. However, Wagh said, the company expects fourth quarter sales to outperform fourth quarter of last year.

news_headline: Mustang EV's roof doesn't come off: Ford EV head in apparent dig at Tesla
news_article: Ford's electric vehicles head (EV) Darren Palmer, in an apparent dig at Elon Musk's Tesla, said his company's electric car Mustang Mach-E's "roof doesn't come off when you wash it". He said its "doors fit properly, the plastics and other materials color-match and the bumpers don't fall off". Earlier, roofs of Tesla Model Y vehicles flew off on two instances.

news_headline: Tesla opens its largest Supercharger station in Shanghai
news_article: Tesla has unveiled its largest Supercharger station in Shanghai, China, with 72 charging stalls. The electric vehicle (EV) manufacturer has defeated its own record of single-point EV super-charging station with 56 stalls that it opened in California in 2020. Tesla has also been expanding its network of service centres and is planning to add one centre every week in 2021.

news_headline: Tesla responsible for 2/3 of all my pain combined: Elon Musk
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has tweeted, "Tesla is responsible for 2/3 of all the personal & professional pain in my life combined. But it was worth it." He added that at Tesla's start he thought it had "(optimistically) a 10% chance of surviving at all". Musk praised Tesla's team for producing and delivering nearly half a million cars in 2020.

news_headline: Tesla beats 2020 delivery estimates, falls short of Musk's target
news_article: Tesla on Saturday reported 4,99,550 vehicle deliveries during 2020, bettering Wall Street estimates of 4,81,261 vehicles, according to Refinitiv data. However, annual deliveries fell slightly short of CEO Elon Musk’s target of 5,00,000. Musk had set the target before the COVID-19 pandemic struck, and maintained it even as its only US plant was forced to shut for several weeks.

news_headline: 7 Tesla EVs imported to Nepal in 2020
news_article: Around seven Tesla electric vehicles (EVs) were imported to Kathmandu, Nepal, in 2020, despite the fact that Tesla has not officially launched in the country yet. The vehicles were imported from South China EXIM by automobile dealers Shreema Distributors and ARETE International. Five Tesla cars have been sold so far, an official from ARETE International said.

news_headline: Entertainment will be critical when cars drive themselves: Elon Musk
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, while discussing in-car gaming in autonomous vehicles, tweeted, "Entertainment will be critical when cars drive themselves." Tesla recently released an update that featured three new in-car video games. Musk said an online multiplayer version of one of the games will be added and asked people what Tesla should do with in-car gaming in an autonomous world.

news_headline: Volkswagen shares first glimpse of mobile EV charging robot
news_article: Volkswagen has shared the first glimpse of the prototype of a fully autonomous mobile electric vehicle (EV) charging robot. The robot starts up by either using an app or through communication with the car itself and independently steers the vehicle to be charged. The robot is also capable of charging several vehicles at the same time.

news_headline: Tesla car navigates 576 km in Full Self-Driving with no human help in US
news_article: A Tesla driver made a six-hour-long journey from Los Angeles to San Jose, travelling almost 576 km, in the Full Self-Driving mode with almost no human interventions. The driver claimed that they refrained from steering the car, accelerating or braking, except to make one stop to charge the car. They took control once to avoid large debris on road.

news_headline: Tesla Model Y debuts as police patrol vehicle in New York
news_article: Tesla Model Y debuted as a police patrol car in New York. It is reportedly the first-ever Model Y to be equipped as a police vehicle worldwide. The Model Y will serve as the police car assigned to the Detective Division of police. It has been outfitted with lights, sirens and radio to aid the police in its activities.

news_headline: Tesla Full Self-Driving's safety to be above avg driver's in 2021: Musk
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted he is confident Tesla's "Full Self-Driving will work at a safety level well above that of the average driver this year". He said this in response to a post talking about Musk being confident that Tesla will be able to achieve level five autonomy next year. Tesla recently released an update featuring in-car video games.

news_headline: Tesla to start delivering its China-made Model Y SUVs this month
news_article: Tesla has started selling China-made Model Y SUV and will deliver them to customers this month. The starting price of a Model Y in China is now $52,028.16, according to its China website. Tesla recently launched its largest Supercharger station in China. The new station has 72 stalls of Tesla's V2 Supercharger, which can output 150 kW.

news_headline: Fiat Chrysler to invest $250 million in India unit
news_article: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA) has said it will invest $250 million in India to launch four new sport-utility vehicles (SUVs) over the next two years, taking its total investment in the country to over $700 million. The company will produce and assemble the new SUVs at its car plant in Maharashtra, which it jointly owns with Tata Motors.

news_headline: Tesla stock that gained 740% in 2020 gets divided price targets for 2021
news_article: JPMorgan analysts have rated Tesla stock "underweight" and given it a price target of $90 for 2021, an 87% drop from current levels. On the other hand, Goldman Sachs has a "neutral" rating for Tesla, with a 12-month price target of $780. Tesla opened at $84.90 on January 2, 2020, and gained 740% over the year to close above $700-mark.

news_headline: Tesla signs five-year deal with Chinese company for lithium supply
news_article: China's Sichuan Yahua Industrial Group has signed a five-year deal with Tesla to supply battery-grade lithium hydroxide to the EV manufacturer. The total value of the contract was put at $630-880 million over 2021-25 in a filing to the Shenzhen Stock Exchange, Reuters reported. Ganfeng Lithium, one of the world's largest lithium producers, also supplies the commodity to Tesla.

news_headline: Tesla short sellers lost $38 bn in 2020 as shares surged 730%
news_article: Tesla short sellers lost over $38 billion in mark-to-market losses this year as the electric vehicle maker's shares surged over 730%, according to data from S3 Partners. The next-biggest loss for short sellers was on Apple at $7 billion. This "is the largest yearly mark-to-market loss I have ever seen," Ihor Dusaniwsky, Managing Director of S3 Partners said.

news_headline: Jeff Bezos names Blue Origin's landing ship after his mother
news_article: Jeff Bezos on Wednesday unveiled Blue Origin's latest landing ship and revealed that it has been named after his mother, Jacklyn Bezos. "New Glenn's first stage will come home to the Jacklyn after every flight," he wrote in an Instagram post. The 600-foot ship has been designed as a floating landing point for the first-stage booster of New Glenn rocket.

news_headline: Doctors hear Mexican song while checking pulse in 65-year-old US man's feet
news_article: A 65-year-old US man, who had undergone hip-replacement surgery, visited a hospital after experiencing a fall and dislocating his hip. When doctors assessed pulse in his feet using a Doppler device, they heard a Mexican song playing through the device's speaker. Doctors assume that Doppler might've picked up a radio signal that was being received by the patient's prosthetic hips.

news_headline: NASA takes pic of 'Wolf Moon'; shares the story behind the name
news_article: NASA shared a picture of 'Wolf Moon', the 13th and final full Moon of 2020 that will be visible for about three days. NASA said the Algonquin tribes of what is now the northern and eastern US named it 'Wolf Moon' as packs of wolves howled hungrily outside villages in winter. Another name for it is 'Ice Moon', NASA said.

news_headline: 2011-2020 warmest decade on record: World Meteorological Org
news_article: The decade from 2011 to 2020 is the warmest recorded decade ever, according to the World Meteorological Organization (WMO). "This year is on track to be one of the three warmest on record and may even rival 2016 as the warmest on record. The six warmest years have all been since 2015," the WMO tweeted.

news_headline: India's highest meteorological centre opens in Leh at 3,500 m above sea level
news_article: Union Minister Harsh Vardhan on Tuesday inaugurated India's highest meteorological centre established at 3,500 m above sea level in Leh by the India Meteorological Department (IMD). It will provide specialised weather forecasts for traffic movement on highways, agriculture and defence personnel. After Itanagar in Arunachal Pradesh, the Leh centre is the second MC located in the Himalayas.

news_headline: Firework that lasted for 150 yrs: NASA on pic of super-massive star Eta Carinae
news_article: The official Instagram page of NASA has shared the picture of Eta Carinae, a doomed super-massive star 7,500 light-years away that went through a "Great Eruption" in the 1840s that made it the second-brightest visible star in the sky for over a decade. "Have you ever seen a slow-motion firework show that lasted...over 150 YEARS?" wrote NASA.

news_headline: Intact Ice Age-era woolly rhino discovered in Siberia
news_article: Paleontologists have found one of the best-preserved specimens of an Ice Age-era woolly rhino to date in Siberia. The rhino is believed to have lived in the late Pleistocene era, anywhere between 20,000 and 50,000 years ago. It was discovered with all its limbs, some of its organs including part of the intestines, its tusk and a lump of fat.

news_headline: Cancer drug outperforms remdesivir against COVID-19 virus: Study
news_article: Researchers said pralatrexate, a drug originally developed to treat lymphoma, has outperformed remdesivir drug against SARS-CoV-2 in lab settings. Haiping Zhang of the Shenzhen Institutes of Advanced Technology and others screened 1,906 existing drugs for their potential ability to inhibit replication of SARS-CoV-2. Pralatrexate and azithromycin successfully inhibited replication of the virus.

news_headline: Puerto Rico commits $8 mn to rebuild collapsed Arecibo telescope
news_article: Puerto Rico Governor Wanda Vázquez Garced has signed an executive order approving $8 million to rebuild the world's second largest radio telescope at the Arecibo Observatory. The order stated the reconstruction as a matter of "public policy". The Governor has also declared the observatory site a historic zone. The telescope had collapsed due to structural problems on December 1.

news_headline: IIT-B researchers create AI model to identify malaria parasites
news_article: Researchers from IIT-Bombay have created an AI-based model using proteomics technology that can help differentiate between two major species of malaria parasites, P falciparum and P vivax. These species are not differentiable using the rapid diagnostic tests (RDT), Shalini Aggarwal, who was part of the study, said. The researchers are currently working on developing a diagnostic kit prototype.

news_headline: Japanese university to develop wooden satellites to cut down space junk
news_article: Japan's Kyoto University is teaming up with Japanese forestry company Sumitomo to develop wooden satellites to shoot into orbit by 2023 in a bid to cut down on space junk. Kyoto University professor and astronaut Takao Doi said wooden satellites, while burning on re-entry after falling out of orbit, release less harmful particles than metal satellites.

news_headline: SpaceX will try to 'catch' boosters returning from space: Elon Musk
news_article: Elon Musk said that SpaceX will "try to catch" Super Heavy rocket boosters returning from outer space instead of making them land. This will be done with the help of a launch tower arm, he added. Currently, the return of Falcon 9 boosters involve touching down on a boat or a launchpad using "legs" that are built into the rocket.

news_headline: Sunquakes may originate over 1,000 km beneath Sun's surface: NASA
news_article: NASA scientists suggested seismic activity on the Sun during solar flares, sunquakes, might be originating from 1,126.5 kilometres beneath its surface. Earlier, scientists believed magnetic forces or heating of Sun's outer atmosphere caused sunquakes. Scientists' new conclusion came after observing a sunquake with unusually sharp ripples produced from a moderately strong solar flare in 2011.

news_headline: China to open world's largest radio telescope to int'l scientists in April
news_article: China will officially open the world's largest single-dish radio telescope to international scientists, starting April 1. The 500-metre Aperture Spherical radio Telescope (FAST) has a diameter of half a kilometre and had started operations in January last year. It has a receiving area equivalent to about 30 football fields.

news_headline: Sinking land may affect 635 million people worldwide by 2040: Study
news_article: The gradual sinking of land could affect 635 million people globally by 2040, according to new research funded by UNESCO. During the past century, land subsidence due to groundwater depletion occurred at 200 locations in 34 countries. Researchers said most of the 635 million inhabitants in subsistence-susceptible areas are located in Asia, with a total exposed GDP of $9.78 trillion.

news_headline: 10 costliest disasters of 2020 caused $150B worth of damages: Report
news_article: The ten costliest weather disasters this year worldwide caused insured damages worth over $150 billion, NGO Christian Aid reported. They claimed at least 3,500 lives and displaced more than 13.5 million people. Five of the most costly extreme weather events were related to Asia's unusually rainy monsoon. Only 4% of economic losses from climate-impacted events in low-income countries were insured.

news_headline: US aquarium agrees to delay 5 beluga whales delivery amid lawsuit
news_article: US-based Mystic Aquarium has agreed to delay acquisition of five beluga whales for research amid a lawsuit by an animal rights group trying to stop the delivery. The lawsuit said the whales would be harmed by the trip from their home. It added that they will also be harmed by being torn from long-term relationships with others of their species.

news_headline: 2020 8th warmest year in India in 121 years: IMD
news_article: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said that 2020 was the eighth warmest year India recorded in the last 121 years. Last year, the annual mean land surface air temperature average was 0.29°C above normal, for the period average considered between 1981 and 2010. However, it was much lower than 2016 (+0.71°C), which remains the warmest year recorded since 1901.

news_headline: Scientists make film that absorbs sweat's moisture, helps power devices
news_article: NUS scientists have developed a film that is "extremely effective in evaporating sweat" from the skin and then absorbing the moisture from sweat. The film can rapidly release water on exposure to sunlight and can be "regenerated" and reused for more than 100 times. Scientists also made a wearable energy harvesting device comprising eight ECs, using the film as electrolyte.

news_headline: Researchers discover new Indian Muraingrass species in Western Ghats
news_article: Researchers from Pune's ARI and the University of Goa claim to have discovered a species of Indian Muraingrass along the Western Ghats. They said the species has fought harsh conditions to survive in the ecologically-sensitive region. The species was identified after morphological studies of samples collected from laterite surfaces in the outskirts of Goa's Bhagwan Mahavir National Park.

news_headline: India's 40th scientific expedition to Antarctica to leave from Goa on Jan 5
news_article: India's 40th scientific expedition to Antarctica will leave on a ship from Goa on January 5 with 43 members, less than the conventional strength, due to COVID-19. The vessel will sail from Goa's MPT to Cape Town, from where it will reach Antarctica in about 18 days. Two helicopters will be added to the expedition at Cape Town.

news_headline: ISRO chief K Sivan's tenure extended by one year
news_article: The Centre on Wednesday extended the services of ISRO chief K Sivan as Space Secretary and Space Commission Chairman by a year. Sivan was provided the extension since the space programme's flagship projects, Gaganyaan and Chandrayaan-3, are still pending. His tenure will now be up to January 14, 2022, or until further orders, whichever is earlier.

news_headline: 153-yr-old Patna Met Centre gets centennial observing station status
news_article: The WMO has awarded the status of 'centennial observing station' to the Patna meteorological observatory. "With this recognition, Patna has joined a niche club of cities having a long-term record of scientific observation in the field of meteorology, climatology and applied science," Centre's Director Vivek Sinha said. Patna meteorological observatory was established in 1867.

news_headline: China's Mars probe travels 400M km in 163 days, to enter Mars' orbit in Feb
news_article: China's first Mars exploration mission Tianwen-1 travelled more than 400 million kilometres by January 3 and is expected to enter Mars' orbit next month, China's space agency said. It was about 130 million kilometres from Earth and about 8.3 million kilometres from Mars. After entering Mars' orbit, it will spend two-three months surveying potential landing sites.

news_headline: New mutations in malaria parasite behind preventive drug resistance: Study
news_article: LSHTM researchers have said new mutations that enhance resistance to a drug used to prevent malaria in pregnant women and children are already common in countries fighting the disease. Mutations in two genes in the parasite plasmodium falciparum offer resistance to sulfadoxine-pyrimethamine, but recently, mutations related to resistance were discovered in a third gene, pfgch1.

news_headline: Elon Musk overtakes Bezos to become the world's richest person: Bloomberg
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Thursday overtook Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos to become the world's richest person with over $187-billion wealth, Bloomberg said. Jeff Bezos has held the top spot among the world's richest people since October 2017. Over the past year, 49-year-old Musk's net worth soared by more than $150 billion as Tesla share price surged 743% last year.

news_headline: Total cryptocurrency market value crosses $1 trillion for the 1st time
news_article: The total market value of cryptocurrencies passed $1 trillion for the first time on Thursday. The market value has climbed fivefold in the past year, as per CoinGecko data. Bitcoin, which rose 4% on Thursday to hit a record high of $37,000, represents around two-thirds of the cryptocurrency market value. Ether represents about 14% of the market value.

news_headline: How strange...well, back to work: Musk after becoming world's richest person
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, who on Thursday overtook Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos as the world's richest person, tweeted, 'How strange', after achieving the milestone. In another tweet, he said, "Well, back to work." A 4.8% rally in Tesla shares boosted Elon Musk's net worth past Jeff Bezos' net worth on Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

news_headline: Tim Cook, Sundar Pichai condemn violence at US Capitol
news_article: Apple CEO Tim Cook, condemning the violence at the US Capitol on Wednesday, said, "Today marks a sad and shameful chapter in our nation's history."
